第29届西班牙戈雅奖(2015)

writer.name: 佩德罗·冈萨雷斯·贝勒穆德 Pedro González Bermúdez

director.name: 佩德罗·冈萨雷斯·贝勒穆德 Pedro González Bermúdez

this_title: El último adiós de Bette Davis
introduction: 'When Bette Davis bid farewell' is a documentary that reconstructs Bette Davis' visit to the San Sebastian Film Festival where she was awarded the Donostia prize in 1989. The actress spent six days in her room planning her public appearances down to the last detail: the award ceremony, an unforgettable press conference - When the festival finished Bette Davis decided to stay on a few more days, but it wasn't long before she started feeling unwell. She was flown to the American Hospital in Paris where she was to die a few days later. What nobody could have imagined beforehand was that the San Sebastian Film Festival would turn out to be the final performance of one the great stars from Hollywood's golden era. 'When Bette Davis bid farewell' bring together eyewitness accounts from journalists, photographers and members of the organization who worked in the San Sebastian Film Festival that year. The film features a special contribution from Kathryn Sermak, the personal assistant who accompanied the actress on the visit and on whom the actress relied in the final stages of her life.
foreign_title: El último adiós de Bette Davis
